author: craigmcc
msg: Render a platform-independent line ending instead of hard coded "\r\n".
This should have no visual effect, but it allows the "TestErrorsTag1" test
suite to pass on a Linux server.  Feel free to revert if this causes problems

author: jmitchell
msg: This file is not used for any tests that we have.  Even if
it was, it is just a copy of jspRedirector.jsp at /web/test/

author: jmitchell
msg: Fix Include to to assume the context is '/test'

author: jmitchell
msg: Update redirector to a version that (at least) compiles with
I still cannot make any tests pass that call request.getServerPort() in the
Cactus 1.4.x environment.  This may be a known bug with that project
or perhaps a mismatch of dependent jars.
For now, our tests will only run on Cactus 1.3

author: dmkarr
msg: Separated "expr" attribute into "expr" and "exprValue", being the original
attribute value and the evaluated value.  Before this, a reused tag instance
Fixed probably long-standing bug in notMatch tag that made it behave
identically to the "match" tag (instead of the reverse).  This is only with
respect to the "expr" attribute, only used in the EL tag.
